thread.title: Hoosiers get shot for signature win against No. 1 Ohio St.
thread.title_full: Hoosiers get shot for signature win against No. 1 Ohio St.

author: MICHAEL MAROT
title: Hoosiers get shot for signature win against No. 1 Ohio St.
text:
Sports Hoosiers get shot for signature win against No. 1 Ohio St. Ohio State running back Ezekiel Elliott escapes the grasp of Western Michigan defensive end Kelon Adams during the fourth quarter of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Sept. 26, 2015, in Columbus, Ohio. Ohio State defeated Western Michigan 38-12. (AP ... more > By MICHAEL MAROT   
INDIANAPOLIS (AP) - Indiana is trying to keep Saturday’s game in perspective. 
Sure, the Hoosiers are off to their best start in 25 years, on their longest winning streak since 1987 and have a chance to rock the college football world by upsetting No. 1 Ohio State. 
But players and coaches realize they must treat the Big Ten’s only weekend matchup between unbeaten teams like any other game. 
Indiana (4-0) is attempting to snap a 20-game losing streak against a team it has beaten only two times since 1952. 
The Buckeyes (4-0), meanwhile, are focused on avoiding a potential pitfall on the road - one that could derail their quest for back-to-back national championships.
